elements.title: wood type (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that wood type for printing (example pictured) was invented in China, first mass-produced in the United States, and later exported back to China for use by missionaries?

elements.title: William Pinckney (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that William Pinckney was the second Black American to be awarded the Navy Cross, the second-highest decoration for valor in combat, after the Medal of Honor?

elements.title: Franco-Greek defence agreement (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Franco-Greek defence agreement is the first intra-NATO defensive alliance?

elements.title: Fateh Muhammad Panipati (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Fateh Muhammad Panipati has been called the al-Jazari of contemporary times?

elements.title: Harris Computer Systems (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Harris Computer Systems specialized in making computers for real-time simulation?

elements.title: Kit Malone (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that LGBT rights activist Kit Malone helped create the first transgender organized marching group in the Indianapolis Pride Parade's history?

elements.title: Salmo 150 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in a choral tour program titled Salmo!, Bach's 18th successor first conducted Salmo 150, an a cappella setting of Psalm 150 by the Brazilian composer Ernani Aguiar?

elements.title: Herb Wong (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that zoologist Herb Wong wrote the liner notes for more than 600 jazz albums, by his own count?
